title: Any plans for fixing Yasuo?
body:
Remove his passive shield and double cirt he doesnt need it.
Thanks

replies.body: Sadly  no, because he has to stay broken for more than 6 years and his 12 year old playerbase will start crying.
That's his whole passive. It might be more helpful to suggest a replacement that has better counterplay while retaining his theme as a dashing swordsman.

he needs something to compensate for his diving because he's squishy and it's dangerous to just go in and dive. If they remove his passive shield and double crit. Then they need to give him a new passive and change his w to help out in duels.
Yeah and we really dont want yasuo to be squishy, I mean he HAS To be good at everything. We cant give him some actual counterplay, that would be bad.

> [{quoted}](name=DontLewdOrianna,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=nzq0EHA7,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-04-26T21:49:59.661+0000)
>
> Yeah and we really dont want yasuo to be squishy, I mean he HAS To be good at everything. We cant give him some actual counterplay, that would be bad.

Nice strawman. This goes for all champions. Diving is risky even for tanks. ADC's can sit in the back and auto attack. Assassins these days have good escapes. When yasuo goes in, he becomes very dependent on his team.
